metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4483 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 40.0 allows man-in-the-middle attackers to bypass amixed-content protection mechanism via a feed: URL in a POST request.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4483` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-globalmenu - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-mozsymbols - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-testsuite - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.4').
